qas.question: What belief is required of a candidate by the Grand Lodge?
Are candadites required to express belief in a specific religion?
Which branch of Freemasonry does not require a belief in a supreme being?
Which branch of Freemasonry accepts atheists?
Which branch of Freemasonry only accepts Christians?
Most Grand Lodges require a candidate to declare a belief in what?
Freemasons most common in Scandinavia only accept who as members?
The Grand Orient de France is considered what type of Freemasonry?
What belief is optional of a candidate by the Grand Lodge?
Which branch of Freemasonry does not allow a belief in a supreme being?
Which branch of Freemasonry executes atheists?
Which branch of Freemasonry only accepts children?

context: In addition, most Grand Lodges require the candidate to declare a <a0_0><b9_0>belief in <a5_0>a Supreme Being<b9_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/>. In a <a1_0>few cases<a1_0/>, the candidate may be required to be of a specific religion. The form of Freemasonry most common in Scandinavia (known as the <a4_0><b12_0>Swedish Rite<b12_0/><a4_0/>), for example, accepts only <a6_0>Christians<a6_0/>. At the other end of the spectrum, <a3_0><b11_0>"<a8_0>Liberal" or <a2_0><b10_0>Continental<b11_0/><a3_0/> Freemasonry<b10_0/><a8_0/><a2_0/>, exemplified by <a7_0>the Grand Orient de France<a7_0/>, does not require a declaration of belief in any deity, and accepts atheists (a cause of discord with the rest of Freemasonry).
